ValueDomain.preferredName: Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Imaging Technique Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indication of type of upper tract imaging, obtained from UTI report.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The creation of an image of the kidneys and urinary system using an intravenously administered contrast medium. By taking several X-rays over a short period of time, it is possible to check for the proper functioning of both kidneys and the urinary system.

Concepts.definition: The creation of an image of the kidneys and urinary system using an intravenously administered contrast medium. By taking several X-rays over a short period of time, it is possible to check for the proper functioning of both kidneys and the urinary system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: X-ray images of the ureters and kidneys obtained by injection of a radioopaque substance into the ureter, usually done via a cystoscope.

Concepts.definition: X-ray images of the ureters and kidneys obtained by injection of a radioopaque substance into the ureter, usually done via a cystoscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.21 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002164. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
